III.    Facility Identification

The Greencore facility is located at 720 Center Street in Carol Stream, Illinois.  Greencore is a contract food packaging and co-manufacturing facility that provides manufacturing / processing support, secondary packaging and shipping to suppliers and distribution centers. 



The NAICS code for the facility is 31199.  A large portion of the facility is refrigerated to preserve products for packaging and distribution.   



The facility uses ammonia for refrigeration, and is regulated under 40 CFR Part 68, the EPA RMP Rule. There is one (1) refrigeration system onsite that is used for refrigerating production areas, coolers and freezers throughout the facility. 



The amount of ammonia currently onsite has been estimated at approximately 28,000 pounds.  



An aerial map identifying the site location is included as Appendix A. 



IV.    Hazard Assessment - Worse Case Scenarios (WCS)

Appendix B consists of the RMP*Submit Printout and contains additional information on the worst-case scenario.  Appendix C consists of the offsite consequence analysis data and maps for the worse case release scenario. 



V.    Hazard Assessment - Alternative Release Scenarios (ARS)

Appendix B consists of the RMP*Submit Printout and contains additional information on the alternative release scenario.  Appendix D consists of the offsite consequence analysis data and maps for the alternative release scenario. 



VI.    General Accidental Release Prevention Program

A prevention program has been developed to minimize the risk of hazardous chemical releases in accordance with the OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) standard (29 CFR 1910.119) and the EPA Risk Management Program.   



This prevention program covers those processes that handle ammonia above the threshold quantity for both PSM and RMP rules. The most recent a

udit of the PSM and RM programs was conducted on July 12-14, 2016, in compliance with the requirement to conduct PSM audits every three years.  The elements of the PSM / Program 3 prevention program and a brief description are listed below.

?    Employee Participation - Greencore has developed a site-specific employee participation plan that ensures employees and their representatives are consulted when conducting and developing process hazard analyses and other information required to be developed under the PSM/RMP regulation.  In addition, the employee participation program will ensure employees and their representatives have access to process hazard analyses and all other information required to be developed under PSM/RMP.  

?    Process Safety Information - Greencore maintains a site-specific PSI program that ensures information pertaining to the hazards, technology, and equipment of the process are properly developed and maintained. Process safety information for the ammonia process has been compiled and was last reviewed on January 27, 2017.

?    Process Hazard Analysis - Greencore has developed a site-specific PHA program that ensured a PHA was conducted initially, at a minimum of every five (5) years, and whenever a change is significant enough to require a change in PSI.  In addition, this program ensures PHAs are conducted in accordance with OSHA and EPA regulations and ensures findings and recommendations of PHAs are properly documented. Greencore conducted a thorough, PHA revalidation study for the refrigeration system during June, 2016. A PHA study was also conducted for changes made to system during January, 2017.

?    Operating Procedures - Greencore has developed a site-specific procedure that ensures operating procedures provide clear instruction for different phases of process operations and ensures they are properly maintained.  Annually, the operating procedures are reviewed and certified as accurate. Greencore has developed a site-specific training proc

edure that ensures employees operating the ammonia process have the knowledge to safely operate the process, are aware of the potential hazards of the process, and understand the causes of process problems.

?    Management of Change - Greencore has developed a site-specific management of change procedure that ensures changes (except for replacement in kind) to the ammonia process, such as additions of new equipment or changes in operating, maintenance, or other procedures are documented. 

?    Pre-Startup Review - Greencore has developed a site-specific pre-startup safety review procedure that ensures a safety review is performed when modifications to the ammonia process are significant enough to require a change in PSI.

?    Mechanical Integrity - Greencore has developed a site-specific mechanical integrity procedure that ensures written preventative maintenance procedures are developed and maintained, preventative maintenance tests and inspections are properly documented, and employees maintaining the process receive adequate training.  

?    Contractor Qualifications - Greencore has developed a site-specific contractor qualification procedure that ensures all contract employers' safety performance and programs are evaluated, a contract employee injury and illness log is maintained, information of potential hazards are communicated between Greencore and the contract employer, and required training and information is communicated, such as the provisions of the emergency action plan and control over entrance into process areas.

?    Incident Investigation - Greencore has developed a site-specific incident investigation procedure that ensures each incident that either results in a release or could have resulted in a release of anhydrous ammonia is investigated, within 48 hours, by a team of at least one person knowledgeable in the process.  This procedure will also make provisions to ensure a report is prepared at the conclusion of the investigation and findings are promptly a

ddressed. 

?    Compliance Audit - Greencore has developed a site-specific compliance audit program that ensures compliance audits are conducted at a minimum of every three years to verify that facility PSM/RMP practices and procedures are adequate and are being followed. The most recent compliance audit was conducted on July 12-14, 2016.  

?    Hot Work Permits - Greencore has developed a best management practice for hot work.  The facility's hot work permit procedures for the refrigeration system were reviewed on July 12-14, 2016.



VII.    Five-Year Accident History

The facility has not experienced an accidental anhydrous ammonia release, which resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage onsite, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.



VIII.    Emergency Action Program

Greencore has developed an Emergency Action Plan (EAP) to ensure that in the event of an emergency the facility personnel are aware of the appropriate actions to take and authorities to contact in order to mitigate the effects of a release. 



The facility has conducted emergency drills as a training tool to provide employees proper evacuation procedures and has interacted (i.e. onsite meetings) with the Carol Stream Fire Department. 



Greencore has coordinated their EAP with the Carol Stream Fire Department.  This coordination effort includes providing the agency with a copy of our EAP, and providing a site diagram and hazardous material information, meeting with Carol Stream Fire Department personnel to discuss the facility's operations/processes, and encouraging periodic on-site inspections and coordination with Carol Stream Fire Department personnel.



Greencore has determined that the Carol Stream Fire Department will be utilized for response to all accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia that reach the Immediately Dangerous to Life and Health (IDLH) concentration of 300 parts per million (PPM).





The fa

cility has four (4) windsocks onsite for use in determining wind direction in the event of an ammonia release and evacuation of the building.  The windsocks are located on the Southeast, Southwest, and Northeast corners building, as well as on the west side of the building near the engine room. 



The current Safety Data Sheet (SDS) for anhydrous ammonia is included in Appendix E. 



IX.    Emergency Communications

The telephone numbers of agencies and plant personnel that may be contacted in case of an emergency are available onsite.



X.    Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Chemical safety is an important part of the facility's operations. Greencore is currently implementing their Process Safety Management / Risk Management Programs and continuous improvement in safety is an important goal for the facility.  



XI.    Management Program

Greencore has updated a management system to oversee the implementation of the risk management program elements.  This system has assigned qualified person(s) (or position) to assist in the development, implementation, and integration of the risk management program elements.  If any portion of the program is delegated to others, the names or positions of those individuals will be documented and the lines of authority defined through an organization chart or similar document.  Currently, Gary Home, Refrigeration Engineer, is the PSM / RMP Coordinator and Dan Robin, Plant Manager, is responsible for implementation of the overall Risk Management Program.
